name: Award medal for Swedish Society
obverse: Minerva standing, with a flaming lamp in her hand leans over a sitting woman (Industry) and points to a drawing. Next to the sitting woman is a column with a vase on top. The sitting woman holds a staff by her side. Next to the column is a beehive and cornucopia.
reverse: A wreath encloses a hand-carved inscription. The wreath contains many items: Neptune's trident, a space, an anchor, a torch, a hammer, a scythe, a sickle, and other tools.
reverse_inscriptions: Till A. Hallenberg for framsteg i Skolan
description: This medal was minted to be given to skilled members of the Swedish Society (Svenska Slöjdföreningen).
This medal in particular was given to A. Hallenberg in 1858.
